member.summary: Determine the classification type to be carried out.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Polimago.ClassificationType.None
member.summary: The enum element indicating undefined state.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Polimago.ClassificationType.OneVersusAll
member.summary: Quick classification that tests versus all classes simultaneously (but potentially at the cost of result quality, especially if many classes are involved).

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Polimago.ClassificationType.OneVersusOne
member.summary: Thorough classification that tests all possible pairs of classes (which yields potentially better results if many classes are involved but takes significantly longer than the OneVersusAll approach).

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Polimago.Testing.ConfusionMatrix.Item(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Access the results stored in the confusion matrix. The confusion matrix is to be read as follows: The first index (usually considered the line index) corresponds to the true class index, whereas the 2nd index (column index) is the prediction result. Example: Consider the result counts in a confusion matrix for a two-class problem to be distributed as follows: A B A 10 3 B 1 6 This means that 10 samples of class A have been correctly identified as class A, while 3 samples of class A have been misclassified as class B. Likewise, one sample of class B has been misclassified as class A, while 6 samples of class B have been identified correctly.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Polimago.Testing.ConfusionMatrix.ConfidenceThreshold
member.summary: Threshold to be taken into account when determining the confusion matrix. If the threshold is modified, the whole matrix will be updated accordingly, so setting this property may be a costly action.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Polimago.Training.SearchPredictorFactory.ExtractionRadius
member.summary: Radius for extracting positive search instances. The unit size is the size of the feature window, i.e. a value of 0.5 means that positive samples can be extracted from withing a range of +/- Feature Window Width and +/- Feature Window Height around each trained instance. Smaller values will necessitate a finer search grid but may yield better results on difficult search tasks.

member.summary: Range of scale factors to be covered during classifier training. Only meaningful if the invariance type has been set.

member.summary: Range of permissible singular values to be covered during classifier training. Only meaningful if the invariance type has been set.

member.summary: The maximum number of results that can be extracted in a GridSearch operation. Increasing this value will increase the amount of memory allocated by this object.

member.summary: Sample size that has been used in each training set.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Polimago.SearchPredictor.ExtractionRadius
member.summary: Radius for extracting positive search instances. The unit size is the size of the feature window, i.e. a value of 0.5 means that positive samples can be extracted from withing a range of +/- Feature Window Width and +/- Feature Window Height around each trained instance. Smaller values will necessitate a finer search grid but may yield better results on difficult search tasks.

member.summary: Range of scale factors that was covered during classifier training.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Polimago.SearchPredictor.GridSearch(Stemmer.Cvb.Image,Stemmer.Cvb.Rect,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Perform a grid search.
member.param: Image to search in.
AOI inside the image to search in.
Spacing of the grid points in units of the feature window width/height.
Minimum quality a result must have for being reported.

Minimum distance between the results that this found. If two results that exceed the quality requirement defined by the parameter are spaced less than pixels apart (in either x or y direction) then the result with the lower quality will be eliminated from the result list.

Will receive the number of calls to the predictor's classification routine that have been carried out in the
call.
member.returns: List of results that this found in the area of interest.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Polimago.SearchPredictor.Inspect(Stemmer.Cvb.Image,Stemmer.Cvb.Polimago.SearchResult@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: PMInspect carries out the operation that GridSearch executes for a grid point, starting at the perspective and position defined by the initial value of the parameter SearchResult. When PMInspect returns successfully, SearchResult will contain the final perspective and result quality. For additional information please see the tutorial on search functions of Polimago.
member.param: Image to work on.
Search Result to start with (upon exit: final result)
Maximum number of steps to calculate (upon exit: number of steps actually calculated).
member.returns: true if the found a result when starting at the position defined through the parameter, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Polimago.SearchPredictor.Inspect(Stemmer.Cvb.Image,Stemmer.Cvb.Polimago.SearchResult@,System.Int32@,Stemmer.Cvb.Polimago.SearchResult[]@)
member.summary: PMInspect carries out the operation that GridSearch executes for a grid point, starting at the perspective and position defined by the initial value of the parameter SearchResult. When PMInspect returns successfully, SearchResult will contain the final perspective and result quality. For additional information please see the tutorial on search functions of Polimago.
member.param: Image to work on.
Search Result to start with (upon exit: final result)
Maximum number of steps to calculate (upon exit: number of steps actually calculated).
Search results that lead from the initial value of the parameter to the final value.
member.returns: true if the found a result when starting at the position defined through the parameter, false otherwise.
